LLMAgentR 0.2.0

State Graph Framework

Source: R/state_graph.R
state_graph.Rd

A lightweight framework for building state-driven workflows using nodes, edges, and conditionally branching logic. Each node is a function that takes and mutates a shared `state` list.

Usage

make_node(func, name = NULL)

make_edge(from, to, condition = NULL, label = NULL)

StateGraph()

interrupt(value)

make_command(goto = NULL, update = list())

Arguments

func

A function that takes a `state` list and returns updates.

name

An optional name for the node.

from

The source node name.

to

The destination node name.

condition

An optional function that returns a label based on the `state`.

label

Optional label for conditional branching.

value

A string to print before prompting the user.

goto

Name of the next node to transition to.

update

A list of key-value updates to the `state`.

Value

A list containing the function and optional name.

A list representing the edge.

A list of graph methods: add_node, add_edge, add_conditional_edges, set_entry_point, compile, END_NODE_NAME

A character response entered by the user.

A list with `goto` and `update` keys.

Functions

  • make_node(): Create a Graph Node

  • make_edge(): Create a Graph Edge

  • StateGraph(): Build a State Graph Execution Engine

  • interrupt(): Pause Execution for User Input

  • make_command(): Create a Graph Command Result

Functions

make_node()

Wraps a function in a graph-compatible node.

make_edge()

Creates a transition between nodes, optionally conditional.

StateGraph()

Builds and compiles the state graph engine.

interrupt()

Prompts the user for input during execution.

make_command()

Signals the next node and state updates.

Examples

graph <- StateGraph()
graph$add_node("start", function(state) list(goto = "end"))
graph$add_node("end", function(state) list())
graph$set_entry_point("start")
agent <- graph$compile()
state <- list()
agent(state)
